trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> objects stored in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref>.

A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects that represent subitems of a parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.

Subitems are only displayed in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control when columns are specified in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.Columns%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control and when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView.View%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.View.Details>.
The order of subitems in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> determines the columns the subitems are displayed in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListView> control.
There are a number of ways to add subitems to the collection.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method adds a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> to the collection.

To add a number of subitems to the collection, you create an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects and pass it to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
If you want to insert a subitem at a specific location in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method.

To remove subitems, you can use either the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Remove%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method if you know where the subitem is located in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Clear%2A> method enables you to remove all subitems from the collection instead of using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a single subitem at a time.

In addition to methods and properties for adding and removing subitems, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> also provides methods to find subitems in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the subitem is located in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine where the subitem is located in the collection.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection"></xref> class.
You cannot create an instance of this class without associating it with a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> that owns the collection.
Adds a subitem to the collection with specified text.
This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add a subitem to the collection by specifying the text of the subitem.
When this method is called, a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> is created with the specified text.
You can then use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that is returned by this method to set properties and call methods to manipulate the subitem.

If you already have an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that you want to add to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method that accepts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> as a parameter, or use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add the subitem at a specific position within the collection.
The text to display for the subitem.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> that was added to the collection.
Adds an existing <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> to the collection.

You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method to add an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> to the collection.
This method is typically used to reuse existing subitems from other <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem> objects.
Items that are added to the collection are inserted at the end of the list.
To insert an item into the collection at a specific position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method.

If you want to add an array of existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects as a parameter.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> to add to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> that was added to the collection.
Adds a subitem to the collection with specified text, foreground color, background color, and font settings.
This version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to add a subitem to the collection by specifying the text of the subitem.

In addition, this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method allows you to specify the initial foreground color, background color, and font of the subitem text.
When this method is called, a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> is created with the specified text.
You can then use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that is returned by this method to set properties and call methods to manipulate the subitem.

If you already have an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> that you want to add to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method that accepts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> as a parameter, or use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add the subitem at a specific position in the collection.
By default, subitems use the foreground color, background color, and font specified for the parent item.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `false` to prevent the parent item styles from overriding the subitem styles.
The text to display for the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the foreground color of the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that represents the typeface to display the subitem's text in.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> that was added to the collection.
Creates new subitems based on an array and adds them to the collection.

You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add an array of strings to the collection, where each string in the collection represents the text of a new subitem.

You can use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of strings as a parameter to specify the foreground color, background color, and font for each item being added.

If you want to reuse existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects and add them to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects as a parameter.
If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method.

You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> at a specific position in the collection.
An array of strings representing the text of each subitem to add to the collection.
Adds an array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> objects to the collection.
You can use this method to reuse the subitems stored in a different <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem>.
If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> object, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method.

You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> at a specific position in the collection.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
Creates new subitems based on an array and adds them to the collection with specified foreground color, background color, and font.

You can use this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add an array of strings to the collection, where each string in the collection represents the text of a new subitem.

In addition, this version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method allows you to specify the foreground color, background color, and font for each subitem.

You can use the other version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of strings as a parameter if you do not want to specify foreground color, background color, and font settings for each subitem.

If you want to reuse existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects and add them to the collection, you can use the version of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method that accepts an array of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> objects as a parameter.
If you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem>, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method.

You can also use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Insert%2A> method if you want to add a single <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> at a specific position in the collection.
By default, subitems use the foreground color, background color, and font specified for the parent item.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.UseItemStyleForSubItems%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `false` to prevent the parent item styles from overriding the subitem styles.
An array of strings representing the text of each subitem to add to the collection.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the foreground color of the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> that represents the background color of the subitem.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> that represents the typeface to display the subitem's text in.
Removes all subitems and the parent <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem"></xref> from the collection.
When you remove subitems from the collection, all information about the deleted subitems is lost.

To remove a single subitem from the collection use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Remove%2A> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method.
Determines whether the specified subitem is located in the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> is a member of the collection.

Once you know that the subitem is in the collection, you can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the position of the subitem in the collection.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> representing the subitem to locate in the collection.
`true` if the subitem is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Determines if the collection contains an item with the specified key.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.ContainsKey%2A> returns `false.`
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> to look for.
`true` to indicate the collection contains an item with the specified key; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the number of subitems in the collection.
This property enables you to determine the number of subitems that are defined for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem>.
You can then use this value when you are looping through the values of the collection and you need to provide a number of iterations to perform the loop.
The number of subitems in the collection.
Returns an enumerator to use to iterate through the subitem collection.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerator"></xref> that represents the subitem collection.
Returns the index within the collection of the specified subitem.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method enables you to determine the position of a subitem in the collection.
To determine whether a subitem is contained in the collection before calling this method, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Contains%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> representing the subitem to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the subitem's location in the collection.
If the subitem is not located in the collection, the return value is negative one (-1).
Returns the index of the first occurrence of an item with the specified key within the collection.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> is called successively, the last returned index will be checked for a key match first, and if there is no match, the search starts at the beginning of the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.IndexOfKey%2A> returns -1.
The name of the item to retrieve the index for.
The zero-based index of the first occurrence of an item with the specified key.
Inserts a subitem into the collection at the specified index.
This method allows you to insert a subitem at a specific position in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection>.
To add a subitem without specifying a specific position, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Add%2A> method.
If you want to add an array of subitems to the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
You can use this method if you want to insert a new subitem into an existing collection of subitems.
The zero-based index location where the item is inserted.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> representing the subitem to insert into the collection.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than the value of the property of the .
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
This property is always `false` for this collection.
`true` if the collection is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the subitem at the specified index within the collection.
You can use this method to obtain the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> stored at a specific location in the collection.
To determine the index of a specific item in the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
The index of the item in the collection to retrieve.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> representing the subitem located at the specified index within the collection.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Gets an item with the specified key from the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
If the `key` parameter is `null` or an empty string, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Item%2A> returns `null.`
The name of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> to retrieve.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> with the specified key.
Removes a specified item from the collection.

If you want to remove an item at a specified index or with a specified key, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.RemoveAt%2A> method or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.RemoveByKey%2A> method, respectively.
The item to remove from the collection.
Removes the subitem at the specified index within the collection.
When you remove a subitem from the collection, the indexes change for subsequent subitems in the collection.
All information about the removed subitem is deleted.
You can use this method to remove a specific subitem from the collection by specifying the index of the subitem to remove from the collection.
To specify the subitem to remove instead of the index to the subitem, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Remove%2A> method.
To remove all subitems from the collection, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection.Clear%2A> method.
The zero-based index of the subitem to remove.
The index parameter is less than zero or greater than or equal to the value of the property of the .
Removes an item with the specified key from the collection.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem.Name%2A> property corresponds to the key for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem> in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection>.
The key comparison is not case-sensitive.
The name of the item to remove from the collection.
Copies the item and collection of subitems into an array.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.
The array type is not compatible with <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether access to the collection is synchronized (thread safe).
`true` in all cases.
Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
The object used to synchronize the collection.
Adds an existing <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> to add to the collection.
The zero-based index that indicates the location of the object that was added to the collection.
item is not a .
Determines whether the specified subitem is located in the collection.
An object that represents the subitem to locate in the collection.
`true` if the subitem is contained in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Returns the index within the collection of the specified subitem.
An object that represents the subitem to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the subitem if it is in the collection; otherwise, -1.
Inserts a subitem into the collection at the specified index.
The zero-based index location where the item is inserted.
An object that represents the subitem to insert into the collection.
item is not a .
The index parameter is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the Count property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection has a fixed size.
`false` in all cases.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> at the specified index within the collection.
The zero-based index of the element to get or set.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref> that represents the item located at the specified index within the collection.
The index parameter is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the value of the Count property of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListView.ColumnHeaderCollection"></xref>.
The object is not a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItem"></xref>.
Removes a specified item from the collection.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListViewItem.ListViewSubItemCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The item to remove from the collection.
